message.content:
Artemisia frigida is a species of aromatic herbaceous perennial plant.
It belongs to Asteraceae family and is commonly known as Fringed sagewort.
It is a small, bushy plant that rarely exceeds one foot in height.
The leaves of Artemisia frigida are small, narrow and oblong-shaped, usually gray-green in color with fine hair on the surface, giving a fuzzy texture.
The flowers are yellow-green, and it blooms in late spring to early summer.
It is mainly found in the western and central regions of North America, particularly in the steppes and plains.
Artemisia frigida was traditionally used by indigenous people for medicinal purposes, including treatment for respiratory disorders and digestive problems.
